sentences.english: May I? he said. The Lord has spoken to Malachi.
sentences.chinese: “可以吗？”弛说，“玛拉基接受了神谕。”

sentences.english: There was a momentary silence, profound as what should follow the utterance of oracles.
sentences.chinese: 那一刹那的静穆，如同宣告了神谕之后一般深沉。

sentences.english: I will now go into the oracular trance from which I shall answer your questions.
sentences.chinese: 现在我会进入回答问题的神谕状态。

sentences.english: The theory is that we have to look at markets as oracles.
sentences.chinese: 该理论认为，我们要看看市场的神谕。

sentences.english: His book consists of four prophecies delivered in 521 BC.
sentences.chinese: 他的书包含了四篇神谕，发表于西元前521年。

sentences.english: Hera is using the oracle and King Eurystheus to crush Hercules.
sentences.chinese: 赫拉利用神谕以及欧律斯透斯来彻底打垮赫拉克勒斯。

sentences.english: It was a three-dimensional picture. It was holy teaching that exposed human secrets. My heart began to tremble.
sentences.chinese: 是无字的诗，立体的画，是揭示人生奥秘的神谕。

sentences.english: The ancient oracles were often vague and equivocal .
sentences.chinese: 古代的神谕常是意义模糊和模棱两可的。

sentences.english: Critical heals from Glyph of Dispel Magic properly proc Divine Aegis.
sentences.chinese: 由驱散魔法雕文的治疗暴击可以正确触发神谕之盾。

sentences.english: The will of any one god can be thwarted by perhaps another god.
sentences.chinese: 某一条神谕可能会受到另一个神的反对。

sentences.english: The Greeks were great logical thinkers, but they consulted the Oracles .
sentences.chinese: 希腊人是逻辑严密的思想家，但他们却要参照神谕。

sentences.english: Sybils and oracles are the most ancient institutions of the gentile world.
sentences.chinese: 神谕就是一脚世界的最古老的制度。

sentences.english: Oracles given by the famous in ancient years Delphi Oracle were notorious for being amphigories.
sentences.chinese: 古代希腊德尔菲神庙给出的神谕以模棱两可著称。

sentences.english: In the present paper, the writer tried to show that the Delphic oracle is not the root cause in the formation of Socrates' mission.
sentences.chinese: 德尔斐神谕并非苏格拉底使命形成的根本原因。

sentences.english: The angel told him where to find golden tablets with the word of God.
sentences.chinese: 天使跟他说去哪里找到有神谕的黄金刻写板。

definition: god/spirit/demon/occult or supernatural entities in general
Holy Son/Jesus Christ/God the Son (in the Christian Trinity)
feudal term of praise for ruler, king or emperor/general term for saint in former times/term for God during the Taiping Heavenly Kingdom 太平天國|太平天国/Holy Spirit (in Christian Trinity)
Lucifer (Satan's name before his fall in Jewish and Christian mythology)
to issue a directive/to instruct (that sth be done)
